snippet: Powerful weather tore through parts of the Midwest and South, killing at least 12 people and leaving pockets of devastation across several states.
abstract: Powerful storm system tears through parts of the Midwest and South, killing at least 12 people, leaving pockets of devastation and marking the acceleration of another deadly tornado season; damage is most significant in small city of Harrisburg, Illinois, where 6 people were killed, 100 more injured and blocks of houses and businesses were reduced to rubble.

byline.original: By MONICA DAVEY and A. G. SULZBERGER
byline.contributor: Monica Davey reported from Harrisburg, and A. G. Sulzberger from Kansas City, Mo. Steven Yaccino contributed reporting from Chicago, and Emma Fitzsimmons from New York.

lead_paragraph: Powerful weather tore through parts of the Midwest and South, killing at least 12 people and leaving pockets of devastation across several states.

headline.seo: Storms in Midwest and South Crush Towns
headline.main: Storms Cross the Midwest and South, Crushing Towns
headline.print_headline: Storms Cross the Midwest and South, Crushing Towns
